review.reviewBody: The Beauford coat is just what I needed for these fall wet cold days. I just need to get the zip in liner for when it gets a little bit colder. I also use it for hunting, and I have enough room to wear a nice sweater, and put game in the back pouch.
review.name: Great Rain Protection

review.reviewBody: I had a Barbour Bedale jacket for over 20 years. It was wearing out and bought this as a replacement. Very nice but seems to fit a bit smaller than the Bedale. I had a 38 in the Bedale and needed a 40 for the Beaufort. Essentially the same type of Jacket but a bit longer. Only complaint is that there is no inside pocket as I had with the Bedale.
review.name: Great Jacket, Great price

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought as a gift for Christmas! But I like it. I bought it cause it doesn’t have a hood so won’t mess with her hair or her crossbody bag!
review.name: Christmas gift

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light weight. Fits true to size. Warm without being bulky. I am tall and this fits me well. Looking forward to wearing this in the cold weather.
review.name: Great winter coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket it very light and makes you feel warm right away. I usually don’t go for bulky jackets however this jacket is not that but will definitely keep warm.
review.name: Lightweight Warmness

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this to replace my similar Columbia jacket that was 10 years old. Love that this model has such a high, firm collar. Plenty warm and flexible.
review.name: Warm and comfy coat

review.reviewBody: This coat is supreme in my opinion. It fits me perfectly and keeps me warm all the while looking fantastic.
review.name: So close to a custom fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits true to size. Comfortable and very warm. Definitely recommend
review.name: Comfortable and fits well

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was looking for an Autumn/Spring/Mild-winter-day weight coat for dog walking and casual wear and this is ideal. I'm tall (5'10") and this coat has lovely long sleeves and the length hits at low hip. I had tried on the Patagonia Nano Puff but it wasn't as long as this jacket. The sleeves have additional thumb loop covers that can be tucked away when not needed. The collar has a soft fleecy lining which is very cosy feeling. The jacket feels well made and is comfortably warm down to 0C. Two easy zippered pockets keep my phone, keys, and dog poo bags from falling out. There's also a zippered inside pocket which is handy. All in all, I'm very pleased. I did also try the Powder Lite jacket from Columbia but felt this jacket had a slight edge as far as length, features, and quality.
review.name: Perfect 3 season coat for tall ladies

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this jacket as this seemed like the upgraded version of the one I had for over 5+yrs and loved the updated features. The soft fluffy collar and longer length works better for warmth. Lightweight and easy to pack down to fit into a backpack or large purse. Insulated construction works great. I can see this one lasting for a long time.
review.name: Love this upgraded jacket version

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought for my daughter, she absolutely loves this jacket! Great purchase!
review.name: Great coat!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really love this coat! The fleece pockets, neck line and extended thumb holes make it feel much warmer than the ones I’ve had in the past. It’s a more form fitting coat as well, not bulky.
review.name: Love it!

name: Heavenly Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I've owned another pair of Ortlieb bags for 14 years and they've held up well but I wanted a larger set. These seem like they have the same quality construction with fully adjustable mounting hardware to fit any bike rack. The internal zipper pocket keeps things organized and the outer pocket provides easy access to a lock, lights, etc. The detachable shoulder strap provides convenient portability off the bike.
review.name: Great bags, as usual

review.reviewBody: The day I received these I took my family on a bike ride to go sailing for the day. We should have looked at the weather more closely because there was a big storm that day. We brought the panniers on the boat. We were stuck out for hours in torrential downpour. Everything stayed completely dry, bags exceeded my expectations for them. Ortliebs mounting system is a breeze to use with all our racks. This made me an Ortlieb customer for life! Also, Backcountry had the best deal on these and shipped quickly! I had to call because of an error I made with my card and the rep I spoke with was awesome and super helpful.
review.name: Best purchase and tested on first day

name: Bike-Packer Plus Panniers - Pair

review.reviewBody: They really hurt my feet! Hopefully after wearing them for a while they will feel better!
review.name: They really hurt my feet!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are some of the most comfortable shoes I’ve ever worn, especially straight out of the box. I want them in every color now!
review.name: Veronica Booties Are The Bomb

review.reviewBody: Dislike them. Wish I could return. Not worth the money
review.name: No worth it

review.reviewBody: I absolutely LOVE THE LOOK of these boots, but unfortunately, they are incredibly uncomfortable. Especially when I compare them to every other Frye boots that I have. The hill pinch is really tight to the point where I couldn’t even get it on and these are half a size bigger than I usually get.
review.name: Heel is way too tight

review.reviewBody: I had to return these. They are cute, but my regular size fits my bare foot and I'd like to wear socks. Since I live where I need to order online, I will not be replacing them. I'd have to order and return multiple sizes to find the right fit. Gave 4 stars because seem like nice bootie - took off 1 star for disappointment with fit.
review.name: Cute boot but too small

review.reviewBody: I have a pretty normal/narrow foot and these were so painfully tight in the body of the boot yet loose in the heel, so my foot was pinching and heel coming up when I took a step, I run a true 9.5 as well and have other frye boots that fit perfectly. such a bummer because I love the style so much :(
review.name: Do not fit well

review.reviewBody: The opening of the boot was so small I couldn’t get my foot inside the boot. The boot itself ran big when I placed my foot alongside the outside of the boot. I wear a B width shoe. Perhaps a narrow foot wouldn’t encounter this problem.
review.name: Can’t get it on.

review.reviewBody: Please tell me my pair is defective.How does any one wear these boots? They are beyond painful.
review.name: PAINFUL

review.reviewBody: Bought a pair last year in black. Had to buy a brown pair this year. So soft and so comfortable. I normally wear a 6.5 to 7. The first pair I bought a 6.5. Too tight on my foot. Gave them to my daughter and have 7’s in both now. Perfect.
review.name: Love love love

review.reviewBody: The boots are perfect! They’re well made and look great. The fit is true to size.

Comfortable carry and really like the sleeve to fit over my luggage. I'm a little concerned with how the material will wear. Would prefer to not have scuffs for business meetings.
review.name: Only one trip but really

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] WOW! This is the best Backpack I’ve ever owned.
I actually don’t prefer backpacks but this one is different.
Comfortable! Flexible! Light! Amazing!
It allows you to use as backpack or satchel. The backpack straps stow seamlessly and the amount of pockets is astonishing…Love It!!! Looking forward to traveling with this to Tibet later this year. MGB
review.name: WOW! This is the best

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Only thing it really could use is an external water bottle holder but it was otherwise an excellent option for a lot more space for carry-on
review.name: Only thing it really could

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We already had purchased one of these and it worked out great for our trip to the Galapagos. We have now bought another one for our next trip as I was jealous. Great size for carry on—conforms to Iceland Air carry on measurements. Love the ability to have the backpack straps, the handles and the sling. Love that it fits over the handle of our Transport 90 L wheeled duffle. I don’t care that it gets scratched up….more important for weather protection IMO.
review.name: We already had purchased one

review.reviewBody: We did a 14 day trip to Ecuador which included a one week cruise to the Galapagos. Spouse used the 90 L wheeled duffle in the Transporter line and one of the Transporter Global carry on. Turned out this was a winning combination for one person. So much so, we are buying the exact same combo for me for this year's trip to Iceland. Iceland Air has small carry on restrictions and this seems to be the ideal carry on that has backpack, handle, and carry strap for a multi-option choice and it can easily be slid onto the 90L for the ultimate wheeled experience. Loved the material as we worry about things getting wet on boats or wet climates. True, as others have said, it can look a bit beat up after the first few uses but it is very sturdy. Loved all the features for the Global...lots of storage options and works well with or without packing cubes.
review.name: Part of my winning Galapagos travel gear

review.reviewBody:
Fit under the seat of an American airline plane. 
PROS: Sturdy and very comfy! Cen fit a few days of clothes in it
CONS: I feel like I could have gone a little bigger, and one of the straps tucked into the back seems like it rubbed away some of the material, which also not a big fan of that plastic coating.
review.name: Great for travel!

review.reviewBody: I am a 62 year old female; I just went to Scotland for 13 days of hiking and exploring, and everything that I needed fit in this wonderful backpack. And I flew Icelandic Air, which has very stringent carry-on requirements. The backpack weighs less than 3 lbs, so the remaining 27 lbs was all me:blush: I can't figure out why these aren't more common!
review.name: Transporter Carry-On!!!! My Dream Bag!!

name: Transporter Global Carry-On 36L Pack

review.reviewBody: This is a replacement for another Bell Stratus Mips helmet.  Five weeks ago I crashed on asphalt at 20 MPH and the helmet did its job.  The impact broke my collarbone and fractured multiple ribs along with severe road rash.  I can't imagine the injuries I may have sustained if I was not wearing this Bell Mips helmet.
review.name: May Have Saved My Life!

review.reviewBody:
I went with a medium, but should have sized up. It fits perfect with a bit of adjustability, but I probably won't be able to wear much under it in the cold. But, since this helmet is so open and ventilates extremely well in the heat, I may not wear it in the cold anyway... I wear a size M/L in fitted baseball caps, if that helps you make your choice. I tend to think my head is more on the average side.

It's really comfortable and has fantastic ventilation. Really glad I picked this one.
review.name: Solid pick

review.reviewBody:
Not much to say on this one. It fits, it is comfortable, it gets the job done. Nothing special about it but hey its a helmet. It has a solid safety rating, it uses recent construction tech, and its comfortable on long rides. I would recommend this to friends without a problem.

One comment on size. I have a small head and thus helmets are always a problem when it comes to fit. I would say this runs true to size. What is nice about Bell is that they overlap their sizes well which gives you two options if you are right on the line like me. I went down to the smaller size and open the adjustment almost all the way. I found this more comfortable than going larger and tightening it up most of the way.
review.name: Great basic road helmet

name: Stratus Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody:
I bought a terraframe 50 last summer to use as a backpacking pack, and I liked it so much I bought another for work this spring. I love the guidelite mt frame, it’s incredibly comfortable and versatile. I’ve removed the bag and just used the frame to pack fence posts. The three zip design is the best pack set up i’ve ever used, incredibly easy to get into quickly. The big water bottle holders and side strap are great for holding tools, and the daisy chain on the back is useful to lash things to. I have both bags set up with a stick it plus, water bottle holder, bear spray holder, and a large forager pouch. I also have a hunting lid I use when backpacking.

While the pack is nearly perfect, there are still some improvements that could be made. The biggest thing is how the top of the bag attaches to the frame. It comes with buckles that clip it to the frame, but they are too long and the top of the bag will sink down. I used paracord to hold the top of the bag up, which keeps the top pouch accessible. I would also love to see a slightly larger 3 zip bag, and one that uses a more durable material like 1000d cordura.

I would highly recommend this bag, and more broadly the guidelite frame to anyone looking for a serious pack.
review.name: So Good I Bought Two

review.reviewBody: Doesn't carry much gear but can carry a load comfortably. Hauled 140lbs of gear and 110lb moose quarter comfortably, albeit 5 miles so not very far, uphill over/under fallen logs, marsh pits, and alders. Held up fine. Rifle fit fine in the side pocket, a drop pocket option for rifle would be nice so it doesn't ride so high. Just need to be cognizant of size of gear you want to bring if hunting big game. More comfortable than a maladjusted barney pack from Alaska frontier.
review.name: Worked fine.

review.reviewBody:
DISCLOSURE: I am very well aware that MysteryRanch makes incredible awesome MIL packs specifically engineered for tactical/hostile environments. With that in mind...
Because of my unique role, purchased the Terraframe hoping it would cross worlds really well. I am out-of-my-mind happy with this pack. First of all - just like listed on site, demo'd in videos, etc., this pack has insane space inside as well as build-out options on the exterior. For my needs, I can deploy the shelf and store a plate carrier whether going on a ruck, establishing FOP, etc. It's excellent. Cinching down on the straps keeps the weight near the frame and doesn't hinder pack storage at all.
Here's the insane part: I can even stash the assault pack inside the Terraframe with plenty of space leftover. For example, I'm rockin' a K19 with a proprietary assault pack that attaches to the carrier itself. So I can haul the plate carrier, assault pack, and all necessary gear in the Terraframe - and do so comfortably! - and then when ready, deploy the shelf, grab the assault pack, and I'm ready to go.
Can't say enough good stuff about this pack!
review.name: Like a Boss

review.reviewBody: I've used this pack as a daily hauler for three years on a professional crew doing trail work in the Adirondacks. Daily loads range from 20-60 lbs and the frame + yoke could easily handle more. The pack material is tough and holds up to sharp tools and grease as well as near constant rain and mud. The zippers, straps, and buckles all have held up beautifully. I've used the overload shelf to haul grip-hoists, wire rope, stone drills, and splitting gear without issue. This is a great pack and is overbuilt in every way.
review.name: Tough as Nails

review.reviewBody:
I bought this pack a little over a year ago and immediately started putting it to the test with rucking, backpacking, and hunting. Overall, I really like this pack, but some design features are just killing me. 

The water bottle pockets are good quality, but basically unreachable while hiking. They could be about 1.5x the size as well, seeing as this is the only outer storage option for this pack. 

The upper clip holding the pack to the frame is so frustrating. The fact that every clip around the pack is your standard buckle-clip, and this one is a special "push" clip makes no sense. Every. single. time. I'm loading weight on my frame, it is such a pain to clip in without unclipping it along the way due to the awkward placement. A standard clip here would be much better. 

That being said, I scored this pack during a sale which made it at least $100 cheaper than any hunting pack in the same size. Great quality, holds weight pretty well, and keeps moderately dry in wet weather (PNW). I've carried it for several multi-day trips and it's been good the entire time.
review.name: Good backpack, in need of some better design ideas

review.reviewBody:
I bought this pack several weeks ago in advance of a trip to hike, camp and fly fish Hazel Creek in the Great Smoky Mountains National Park.  The pack provided plenty of room for the four night trip with a trail weight of about 40 pounds.  The external frame and "load sling" make it easy to haul ackwardly shapped or heavy items that would not otherwise fit in a traditional top-loading or roll-top backpack.  I found it to be a very comfortable pack, although a tad on the heavy side (5 pounds total)  for those considering an AT through hike or other extended trip. Mystery Ranch is known for its quality and the construction of this pack is top-notch:  330 Condura Lite Plus with a Carbon Fiber frame.  The pack has three zippers--two diagonal and one vertical.  This makes it easy to open up the entire pack or to simply stuff gear in through the top.  There is a hydration pocket inside and the pack features two top lid pockets that close with high quality zippers.  There are also two open side pockets for tent poles, water bottles, etc.  Numerous, extra-long  external compression straps make it easy to carry your tent body or sleeping pad,  Sevaral webbing loops and MOLLE loops provide additional flexibility for lashing additional gear (like fly rods) to the pack.  

The pack features an adjustable length frame system.  I found that I did not properly adjust the height of the shoulder pads relative to my torso length, but made sure to do so before returning.  A velcro backed yoke makes the adjustment quite easy.  The frame itself is flat and it seems to flex dynamically as you move on the trail.  It has a wide, stiff hip belt that locks securly but comfortably over the hips.
review.name: Mystery Ranch Terraframe 50L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Bought this pack several months ago and have been very impressed with the fit and function. Hauls loads easily and does a great job with packing additional gear in the load shelf. Great pack
review.name: Great pack!

review.reviewBody:
Bought this to compliment my scree for longer trips! Once again, another great product from Mystery Ranch!!

Can’t wait for more opportunities to use this wonderful pack!
review.name: Another awesome pack!

review.reviewBody:
I just had a chance to get it out on the trail for the first time. Construction quality and versatility are great. I'm looking forward to alot of time spent with this bag!
Thanks mystery ranch team,
Kannon
review.name: Seems like a very well built bag!

review.reviewBody: Adjustable, comfortable, perfect amount of space. I love this bag!
review.name: I’ve never had a pack that was more comfortable

review.reviewBody: I really like how easy these bindings are to get into. The toe piece especially. I've been skiing over 60 years, 35 in Jackson, and can recommend these. Also I trust the safety of these bindings, and like the light weight.
review.name: Strive bindings

review.reviewBody: With the changing boot technology the GW take me into the future comfortably
review.name: Light weight, grip walk is huge

review.reviewBody: I have been skiing for years, but always renting.  I decided this year to buy my first complete set up.  I chose to go with Salomon.  I picked up a pair of Stance 96 skis - 2023 (182), S/PRO MV 100 boots, Strive 12 Gripwalk bindings and Arctic S3 poles.  I took them out the first time, on what ended up being very icy conditions.  The equipment performed great and I was very pleased.  A few weeks later I was skiing Jackson Hole.  Skied all over the mountain taking on a variety of difficulties.  No equipment issues.  Then, on what turned out to be my last run of the day, I fell.  Both skis came off.  The brake on my right ski engaged, the brake on my left ski did not.  The last I saw my left ski, it was racing down "Sundance".  I ended up walking down the rest of the run looking for my ski, but never found it.  I understand that sometimes these things happen, but I'm very disappointed that it happened on just my second day of use.  Now I am back to renting for the remainder of the season.  I will buy another set for next year, just not sure what brand I'm going to go with.
review.name: Brake on new binding failed, down a binding & ski

review.reviewBody: Looks classy and covers both clip-in and flat pedal biking depending on my mood. A dream come true!
review.name: Satisfies all desires

review.reviewBody: I bought these with my newly purchased bike, since no pedals came on the bike, and they have been great. I wanted a pair that contained both clip side and clipless side. I have been riding with the clipless side and they feel very solid. The color also looks great on my bike, I purchased red.
review.name: Great Pedals

review.reviewBody:
Never owned a Crank Bros pedal set before. Shimano SPD always. 
Many pedal brands have been in short supply since 2020,  or if available, priced to unaffordable.
I have always been weary of trying C.B  Pedals.  Many people dislike non adjustable clip-less pedals and I was part of this group.   I needed new pedals and every model I wanted was "back ordered"  or way overpriced.
I took a chance and bought these Dbl Shot 3 pedals.  Lots of "pro" reviews rating less than positive but I like the look of them and the fact that the model has been evolving. C.B. Is not correcting mistakes with each upgrade, they are taking input and making them fit more riders needs  No pedal is perfect for every person, I took this into consideration and made the order.
I have only had them a day and I can say without pause they are equal at least to the best pedals I have used in 40 years.  They have a tight spin, meaning you can't spin them a dozen times with your hand.  They stay in the position you took your foot off on.  I love this about them.  Perhaps they will loosen a bit over time but I hope they don't.
The platform is so nice. The length is ideal, most pedals I have used are same dimension side to side/front to back. The platform provides incredible grip and security, better than I have ever felt. No fiddling needed,  anti-seize the threads, put them on and ride.  
The subject of clip-less is very individualized.  I am not a big fan being a full suspension rider but use them in different situations, climbing, etc.  I ride platform 90% of the time but like clip options.  All my pedals have been dual, I find it easy to switch mid pedal, no problem.
The CB clip design surprised me. Easy to clip in from 1st try.  After riding all day I have zero issue with clipping in. Releasing is not easy but the pedals and clips are new.  I can switch to easy release / less degree clips later If bothered by them long term.  Setup is quick, shoe worked perfect with provided clips 1st install.  
Nice looking, perfect pedal bearings with no wild free spinning, great platforms, light weight, adjustable by clip change, spacing for my size 11 wide shoe is ideal, no crank rub clipped in.
If the price is anywhere close to some other brand you are considering, I would get these.
Long term this review is not, but one day of riding 40 miles in them I am a big fan.
I ride 1000's of miles a year, this is just day one,  but I would bet these pedals will last me years.
5 star short term,  4 star due to leaving room for long term aspect
review.name: Give them a try

name: Doubleshot 3 Pedal

review.reviewBody: I didn't buy these for biking, but because it's difficult to find shorts that aren't short shorts or mid thigh shorts for women. Love them length and fit of these. Perfect for kayaking and other outdoor activities. Gave it four stars because the material is a little stiff. Runs true to size. I have a 26 inch waist and 115 lbs and size 2 fit me per normal.
review.name: Great length and fit

review.reviewBody:
Totally disagree with the reviewers that say this runs small - I’m typically a 4 or a 6 in Athleta / Lululemon, and even a 6 can be pretty snug in Lulu specifically. I ordered a 6 in these and am debating returning - they stay up, but the waistband gaps a ton. 5’4 125 pounds for reference 

5 stars otherwise because they seem great quality, and I ordered a size too large due to these reviews, not the company
review.name: Does not run small

review.reviewBody:
My criteria for buying a new pair of bike shorts was that it would hold my iPhone where I could get it out easily. I am normally biking with my kids and like to have easy access to it to snap a photo or check trail forks. I haven't been out with them on the bike yet, but the pocket fit my phone and seemed easy to get to!

Sizing... I typically wear a size 4 or 6 pant/short or a Size Small. I was struggling to get a grasp on sizing based on reviews so I ordered and 4 and 6. The 6 fit way better, especially with a chamois. The 4 was a but snug around the hips and thighs. I would say it probably runs pretty true to size given that I wear a 4 or 6. But I would err on the side of caution and order your larger size if you also wear two differnt sizes.
review.name: Fun Patterns and Pocket Fits a Phone

review.reviewBody: I really love these shorts. The fit is perfect -- not too baggy (like some shorts I own) but not constricting either. I love the four-way stretch. I found that they run true to size. My usual size 4 fit perfectly, though if you want them to fit a little looser it might be good to size up. And I'm all about the patterns -- who doesn't want sloths on their bike shorts?! I'd recommend these to anyone and I plan to give them as gifts to all my MTB lady friends.
review.name: My absolute favorite shorts

review.reviewBody:
THESE ARE THE SHORTS WOMEN HAVE BEEN WAITING FOR!!!

They are SO CUTE, so easy to clean, so comfortable, and 100% for mountain biking. I'm obsessed. 

(Yes, I should've been wearing a helmet in my photo - I forgot it. I'm sorry everyone) XD
review.name: WE'VE BEEN WAITING FOR THIS

review.reviewBody: I ordered the geo dot pattern thinking they were black. They are not black, so I returned... But I do love the fit of these and have them in other colors :)
review.name: Love the fit but returned

review.reviewBody: I saw these shorts and decided to take a chance on them.    I read the other reviewers' reviews to get an idea on sizing.    I was between sizes on the Wild Rye Size Chart.    I am 5' 100lbs.     I ordered both the 2 and the 4.      When  I tried them on,  the Size 2 fit me much better than the 4 which was too big everywhere.     I have and use both compression and baggy shorts when I mountain bike.   I usually do not look great in the baggy look.   I am petite and tend to look overwhelmed or lost in them.    When I tried these on,   I was quite pleasantly surprised.    They actually looked good on me.   I think it is because they have a different profile or outline to them from most of the baggy mountain bike shorts  out there which I think are designed for men .    They are not that wide in the  thighs and quads, but then flare out  a little around the knee.  The nearest thing I can liken  them to is  a capri/knicker  bell-bottom or flare pant.   Additionally,  the length of these shorts  in the size 2 was just right for me even though I am short. It hit at the knee.   Most of these baggy shorts are usually way too long on me.     The material is four way stretch,  an improvement over most other mountain bike shorts which are only two way stretch.   There is no adjustment for the waist either on the outside or the inside of these shorts.   So,  they either will fit you or they won't.    Fortunately for me, they fit.    I usually take anywhere from  a size 2 to a size 6 in  most pants/shorts, so ending up with the Size 2 is in the ballpark.
review.name: Cute, stretchy,  comfy, flattering

review.reviewBody: These are so cute, so comfortable and super flattering. They are really stretchy which makes them great for any ride. I love the pattern too - really fun! They have a nice zipper pocket and front hand pockets. I feel like these do run small, as I usually wear a 0 or sometimes 2 in most things, and I got the 4 in these. You may want to consider sizing up a size.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: I first ordered a 6 given the reviews but sent back for the 4 (my usual size in most brands, but Patagonia/Prana wear 6 -slight loose better than slight tight). They are very stretchy and as other reviewer said they stretch out. 6 would still have worked and 4 a little tight at first but  they stretch out (I am 5'8" 139 more broad shoulders and slimmer thighs if that helps anyone).
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: Purchased swirl dot (blue) in size 6. For reference, I'm size 4 petite women's workwear (e.g. Loft), size small North Face shorts, size 4 Marmot hiking pants, so I figured 6 would be nice and comfy. I was wrong. Material was great, but shorts were tight everywhere you'd want space while mountain biking (hips, thighs). I don't like wearing long shorts, but I took a shot on these just to give them a try - took this as a sign that I should stick to my mid-length shorts for casual riding and regular cycling shorts for more active riding pursuits. Called number with return question and had someone on the phone in less than a minute (pretty unheard of in my customer service experience). Thanks to Ryan for making return process easy and for Backcountry for making shipping and returns process/policy (and charges) transparent on their site.
review.name: No dice :(

name: Freel Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: Way less thick/warm than expected, pretty light insulation. Also fits much smaller than expected. I wear Large in almost everything and Large is too constricting in chest/shoulders
review.name: Bit disappointing

review.reviewBody: It’s a great winter coat, my husband loves it! I ordered an XL and it fits his 6’6” frame perfectly. It’s toasty warm and the Gore-tex keeps him dry. Good sized good as well. We both love the green colour too.
review.name: Perfect winter coat

review.reviewBody: Awesome parka! Trust sizing chart. I’m 6 foot 200lbs and a Large fits perfectly. Extremely warm jacket, durable, comfortable, and I feel invincible when I wear it. If it’s 25°F or below, you’re good to go, anything above that and it’s too warm. Excellent quality!
review.name: Perfect jacket for cold temps

review.reviewBody: The jacket is very well made and warm, but it is a little tight at the bottom. I ordered a small as a 5’9” 170lbs man and the top part fits perfectly the bottom goes to about mid thigh and is a bit tight. I can’t fit my pistol in an owb holster and zip it.  If you’re using it for that I’d order a size up but it may be a bit big up top then. There is a multitude of pockets and they are well sized and most have zippers so I would definitely recommend it; I just wish they had a size exchange. It should be fine if you’re unarmed or carry appendix. Just know due to the length you cant slide it up to draw either
review.name: Great jacket, a little tight

review.reviewBody:
As a parka, it’s great! No complaints on the overall weather resistance to it, as I bought it for daily use in the interior of Alaska Winters. 
The arms deviate from the woman’s design and has down padded insulation  and are a little loose for my taste. I usually need to have a bulkier jacket to fight the chill when wearing it , opposed to my other winter jackets. 
I’m more of an athletic build so the solution could be buying a Small opposed to medium. 
Overall, great jacket.
review.name: Room for Improvement

review.reviewBody: Bought the XL and it was too huge. I'm 6 feet tall and on the skinny side and XL is generally my go to. I exchanged it for the Large and its a much better fit. Arm length perfect. Torso great. The only issue is at the neck line. Fully zipped the darn thing is almost choking me! I put up the hood and that relieves the pressure and feels great. But who wears their hood all of the time?  Coat is warm and all that. If I had tried them both, the XL and the L, on in a brick and mortar store I likely would have purchased neither...
review.name: Overall a good coat -- Having fit issue

review.reviewBody: I just returned from reporting on a blizzard in the Sierras for a national television network. I spent most of five days outside in blowing snow in the low 20s (Fahrenheit). This jacket is incredibly comfortable. I was warm and dry the entire time with just a midweight wool layer underneath. The hand pockets are lined with soft fleece material and are perfectly placed (not too high, not too low) for all-day ungloved comfort. The utility of the rest of the pockets on the jacket is awesome. Lots of secure, dry storage space. If I had one complaint it's that the zipper is sometimes challenging to engage at the beginning...like it's a little undersized for winter conditions. But once you've got it on it's like being indoors when you're outdoors. I'm 5'10", 195lbs and the Large fits perfectly.
review.name: So, so good

review.reviewBody: I've only used this jacket a few times since purchasing it, and not in the rain yet, but the warmth and utility are fantastic. I'm a big fan of the pocket options as this jacket provides the most/best options of any other jacket I've ever tried. The only reason for the 4/5 stars is that the sizing is way way off. I haven't worn smaller than an XL in 12 years but this jacket in XL was comically large. In fact, the L is almost too big as well, but I'm keeping it in case I need to layer on bulky clothes underneath. If you can find the right size, then this jacket seems is a great choice.
review.name: Great Jacket!

review.reviewBody: Great fit and finish with this jacket. The down is spaced apart perfectly and outer fabric of the jacket is quite durable. After searching for the perfect jacket, I can easily say it's been found!
review.name: Stormcraft Excellence

review.reviewBody: A 5 Star coat with a 3 Star zipper. Overall, I’m very happy with the coat. Extremely warm, but still breatheable. Great pockets and snaps. Zipper tracks seem sturdy, but pull and latch is too small and is occasionally difficult to start/unzip. Still, love the coat. Just hope the zipper holds out.
review.name: Great coat, Iffy Zipper

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak 8 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of these shoes. The only  problem is that I wear them so much that the tread is wearing. But I love the fit for my toes. I don't even need a wide because the regular has such a lovely wide toe box. It's the first time in a decade I've worn my true (small) shoe size! The laces are constantly coming undone, so double tying is a must. Maybe there's a solution I just haven't bothered. My feet never get tired in these.
review.name: Great fit for hobbit feet!

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak 8 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I absolutely love my Lone Peak 6s. The 8s seem to be less cushioned and the toe box is not as roomy. I don't think it is the width that is different - it feels more like the material on top of the shoe tapers off toward the toes more sharply which makes the shoe feel shorter. I am so disappointed and don't know what other shoe to try. Maybe customer support can help me find a shoe that fits and feels more like the Lone Peak 6?
review.name: Sadly Doesn't Fit Or Feel Like the Lone Peak 6

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak 8 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have a really hard time with hiking shoes fitting my wide, wide feet. I also have bunions, probably from hiking so much. They have soft sides and toes, so they don't squeeze your toes! I found these shoes and bought them and absolutely love them. I have been wearing them for two days and my feet feel great. I just purchased another pair, because shoe manufacturers always discontinue the shoes you love. I love them.
review.name: Love, Love, love these wide hiking shoes

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak 8 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The toebox is too large. I started wearing Altra in 2018 in the original footbed. All Altra styles fit perfectly. Then they started messing with everything. Between trying them on at REI and ordering styles directly from Altra, nothing fits anymore. I really need the zero drop and stability right now and am very frustrated at having to return yet another pair of Altra shoes.
review.name: What happened?

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak 8 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these shoes to do a walk in Italy. It's was the first walk I've done in which I did not get blisters. My feet felt so good the entire time. Upon returning home I purchased another pair!
review.name: Second round of Lone Peak 8 (Love the purple)

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak 8 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was a competitive sprinter for 8 years. This year I started to have chronic toe pain. I discovered it was from always wearing shoes with a pointy toe box, most often Nikes. These shoes saved me.
review.name: Savior to my toes after a life squeezed into Nikes

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak 8 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I hiked the entire Appalachian Trail in them and continued using them into my real life. I can't say enough about the quality, function, and fit!
review.name: Absolute Superstar Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak 8 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are nice, just not for me! Severe calf pain from being zero drop I think- I don't have this problem with any other running shoes. These also don't have much cushion.
review.name: Zero drop shoes are not for everyone

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak 8 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I NEED THIS SHOE !! IT IS THEY ONLY CLOSED TOE I CAN WEAR !! IT IS GREAT FOR FEET WITH JOINT PAIN
review.name: ABSOLUTELY A GREAT SHOE IN SO MANY SIZES !!

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak 8 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: After wearing these for years with "zero" problems and loving them, I suddenly had problems with my last pair. They are now laced in a half circle at the base of the flap. Relaced the regular way and relief.
review.name: I have worn these for years

name: Lone Peak 8 Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Previous reviewers simply don't know how to read date codes for DMM. It's clearly listed on the DMM website:

All DMM metal products carry a unique serial number. The number allows every single item to be individually traced back to its original date and order of production. The way it works is as follows:
YRDAYXXXX#
YR –Year of Manufacture
08 –2008
09 –2009
10 –2010
11 –2011
12 – 2012 etc…

DAY –The day of the year on which the product was marked
004 –would be the 4th of January
032 –would be the 1st of February
344 –would be the 10th of December

XXXX –Individual serial number
0001 –would be the first component marked on that day
0050 –would be the fiftieth component marked during the day

# – The machine with which the component was serialized
A = Rotary Laser Marker
B or M = Max Box Laser Marker
C = Dot Marker

Example: 081001450A
Yr 2008 – Day 100 – Serial Number 1450 – Machine A
review.name: Learn your dates codes!

review.reviewBody:
Bought an xs bat plate and received it yesterday. This review is more about backcountry as a whole than it is about the product (though, not entirely). 

First thing I did was an inspection of the plate and I noticed the manufacturing date was from 2007!!!!

DMM states that their metal products have no lifespan for obsolescence (good forever from the date of manufacturing). 

However, I still find it odd that the bat plate I received from backcountry is 14 years old (that's some OLD inventory). Just something to consider for those buying any climbing products.
review.name: Aged products
comment: Wow! A valid concern that needs to be addressed by backcountry with transparency.  Recently ordered some Beal dynaloops and received inventory from 2019!  For soft goods valid concern that on some things you're receiving with 1/2 of their recommended lifespan from manufacture date up or more (some petzl gear that's the entire lifespan)!  It would be nice to let us know that we would be receiving inventory with "xxxx-xxx" date of manufacture range.

name: Bat Plate

review.reviewBody:
I bought a pair of the Washburn 42's in May 2023 after the rep in the chat recommended them. I had just bought a new bike whose tires were not tubeless compatible. I currently have 3300 miles on these and the rear is worn pretty well, the front still has some life left in it. The only issue I have had is on the rear tire recently. It got a small hole in it and started leaking, so I added some more sealant and it sealed up. That is when I noticed how worn the tires were and decided it was time to replace them. I'd say that's pretty darn good life for a tire. I have done road rides, smooth gravel, chunky gravel, singletrack, mud, rain; it's a do-it-all tire for sure.
I was going to try some different tires this time around but figured since I had such good luck I would go with the Washburns again.
review.name: Just ordered my second pair of these!!

name: Washburn Tire - Tubeless

review.reviewBody: I bought this coat about a month ago for a trip to Ireland in April. It was windy and temps ranged from 40-55. I bought it based on other positive reviews, but was unfortunately super disappointed. This coat did not stand up to the cold, and the wind went right through it. My husband’s Patagonia nanopuff was perfect for him, so thankfully, I used the extra sweaters he didn’t need. This coat might be good for fall, but I absolutely would NOT recommend for cold and windy weather. I’d way rather have had a Patagonia or my old bulkier Columbia puffer that I used previously.
review.name: Not ideal for cold and wind

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my daughter.  She'd requested a mid-thigh length slim profile puffer sufficiently warm to go out at night through our Massachusetts winter.  She loves it.  Not dressy itself but dresses up nicely worn with boots and a pretty scarf.  And not too bulky to have with you at restaurants and clubs.  We're both very satisfied with the quality.

review.reviewBody: I bought this and am very happy with. The first one got a hole in the pocket but REI replaced it. Fit is great and sleeves are long enough for my long arms.

review.reviewBody: Belt buckle prong broke on 3rd use, rendering the gaiters useless.
review.name: Belt buckle prong broke on 3rd use

review.reviewBody: Works exactly as needed, with zero water coming in, not loud, and handling the harsh brush without becoming shredded. Definitely a worthwhile purchase
review.name: Exactly as needed

review.reviewBody: I was initially skeptical of the durability of these gaiters. They are very lightweight and very packable. I used them on a 10 day hike in the arctic(fall conditions) and they surpassed all my expectations. They performed well in the dry sand, tundra bogs, through rock and boulder scrambles, driving rain and snow as well as the muddy quicksand. They stayed in place well, the draw cord at the top held fast. The waterproofing was excellent and maintained its breathability. Hanging them or laying them out under the tent's fly/vestibule allowed any mositure accumulated through the day to be dry by morning. For these type of conditions I would highly recommend them. I would be suspect of the durability to low branches and brambles in the south, but OR has solid options for that.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Pretty sure they're decent. I had the black heavy duty ones 20 years ago in boy scouts. Served me well
review.name: Haven't tried yet. Look great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am an outdoor enthusiast with a wide range of interest. From summer hikes, backpacking, hiking in the rain, or snowshoeing/mountaineering. These lightweight packable gaiters serve so many functions for me: keeping the dirt, rain, or snow out of my shoes and protecting my legs. Its right in the middle some where in it can be used for all of my activities compared to my heavier pair of gaiters strictly for winter sports or ankle gaiters for short day hikes. Love them, and would recommend them!
review.name: Best mid-zone gaters

review.reviewBody: I wore these gaiters one time and one of the clasps has already fallen off. Really, Outdoor Research? Doesn't bode well for long term or even short term durability.
review.name: Metal clasp fell off first use of these gaiters

review.reviewBody: Being able to replace the straps was a prime reason for buying gaiters.
review.name: Replaceable Straps a Plus

review.reviewBody: I have loved other OR gaiters I purchased. Thus, I bought these gaiters excited to use them. So I threw them in my pack and headed out for a day trip up Mt. Baker. I hit snow, pull out my gaiters, unsnap one, and the snap breaks off instantly. so now I am without a top snap to keep it shut. Then, I pull the string to tighten the gaiter on the top and it also breaks off. I had not even used these once yet and they broke putting them on. These are not fit for the purpose they are designed for if they are so delicate they can't even be put on without breaking. Do not buy these. I am throwing these in the trash as they cannot be relied upon in the mountains.
review.name: Utter garbage. Broke putting them on for the first time.

review.reviewBody: Easy to put on / take off, and manage. Light enough and compact enough to carry until needed.
review.name: Tough for their weight, breathable, waterproof

review.reviewBody: Used these hiking around some high mountain lakes and underbrush in Alaska (during snowy shoulder season). They kept my feet nice and dry. Pair them with a quality set of GTX boots and you're set!
review.name: Dry feet and pants

review.reviewBody: Excellent pack for running and hiking. Also great customer service.
review.name: Excellent pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great little sling that can hold up to 8 liters of water for on the go hydration. It is a good size with ample storage for carrying all of your essentials. Whether you are going on a short hike, quick run, going out for a quick errand or meeting up with some friends, this is the perfect companion, badabing Limitless Sling pack for your everyday needs!
review.name: Badabing Limitless Sling!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great functional bag for all your outdoor needs!!
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: Perfect size and amount of water for hiking and medium-sized trail runs!
review.name: Perfect Size and Fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Solid pack! Built in hydration system is handy, would be great for a festival. I took it out for a day trip and it fit an extra jacket, food and water. Stays close to the body and doesn’t bounce. After a long day the sling can feel a bit imbalanced, but only notice after quite a while on the trail.
review.name: Perfect for a day outing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I loved using the pack for my shorter winter hikes! The multiple pockets are perfect for keeping my extra layers, gloves, and snacks as well as storing my sunglasses. Of course the water bladder is wonderful and packs a great amount of water for a 4-6hr hike. I love the sling as it keeps the pack out of my way while staying secure and easy to access. The extra strap provides great security when I use this pack for faster movements like nordic skiing or running. Lastly, I love the small pocket on the strap to store my chapstick, pocket knife, and other small necessities for hiking.
review.name: Perfect for Winter Hikes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The 8L is the perfect size for mt biking or hiking. Fits all my snacks / water, with room for a light layer! Excited to use this more this summer!
review.name: Perfect size sling!

review.reviewBody: First, he’s cute, right? He keeps my coffee, my hands, and my heart toasty. To be honest, he’s a little too hot to handle at times, but aesthetically, he’s a 10. Just wondering if he’ll ever come in the color oat like the other fellas I’m flirting with, seal tight glass bowls, 16 & 24? Well, just 24 for me. 😉

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had a small issue with a mug I ordered and W&P was very responsive to my inquiry and resolved things quickly and kindly. As a result of their fine customer care, I'll definitely be back when I need more products.

review.reviewBody: The mug cracked after I poured hot water into it, and this was only the fourth time I had used it. The manufacturer refuses to refund or replace it! Shocking! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
review.name: Beautiful but terrible quality! AVOID!!

review.reviewBody: This mug cracked without being dropped or otherwise mishandled. Just over a year old and they won’t stand by the product. Also, it really doesn’t keep drinks warm. Disappointed in this expensive product.
review.name: Cracked

review.reviewBody: Loved the idea of a ceramic travel mug. Second time I used this, it tipped over on its side (bottom is rounded) - was very low-impact. Despite the silicone sleeve, the exposed ceramic top section cracked and mug had to be tossed. Not durable at all!
review.name: Tipped on its side and... broke!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve had this cup for over a month and can confirm that it looks great but is poorly insulated. The cup gets too hot to hold when I make hot water for tea and then my drink tea gets cold extremely fast. I’m sad because the cup is so aesthetically pleasing but it really doesn’t accomplish its one job as a mug!
review.name: cute but doesn’t serve its purpose

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The mug is super lightweight and convenient and all the baristas ask where did I get it. As a consequence the ceramic part is pretty thin and the mug does get hot when you pour hot liquid. The silicone part also expands when hot.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: The design is cute and I love the ceramic combo, however, the cup design isn’t sturdy. The lid doesn’t seal tight and the cup tips over easily. The slightest bump or nudge to the cup will knock the cup over and lid falls off easily. I’ve had plenty of travel mugs and they’re much sturdier. I’ve spilled my entire coffee multiple times with this mug, which is mot normal. The bottom of the cup is round instead of flat. The silicone has no grip to prevent tilting either. The lid doesn’t secure tight. Needs improvements to be a reliable traveler mug.
review.name: Cute but design flaws

name: Ceramic 12oz Mug

review.reviewBody:
The good: The fabric is awesome - super stretchy and seemed to last ok, although I've only taken the pants out on one climb and used traveling a bit. Pants are very comfy. 

The bad: These pants are REALLY THIN. They look more or less painted on. You can see the outlines of the pockets and everything inside. I got the khaki color and either I needed to size up more, go with a darker color, or both. I just felt a bit awkward wearing these pants, like I was wearing see-through tights. I also took a star off because the stitching on the side right above the bottom zipper has come out on both sides (i.e. not just bad luck). 

Sizing: I got a 0 which is my normal size, but by the size chart, I'd be a 2. The fit seemed comfy and good, just fit more like leggings.

In sum: if they were on sale (given the stitching issue), would try these again in a dark color and sized up.
review.name: Comfy but very thin, didn't last

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these--soft, stretchy.  BUT, fit is weird.  calves are snug (I do have fairly muscular calves) which made for bunching at the knees and a weird look.  It is possible a 4 would have fit better than the 6 (although may have been too tight in calves, for me), or a short?  I am 5'4 for reference and the 4 short in the Quandary pant ending fitting well so kept that one instead.
review.name: weird fit

review.reviewBody: It hard for me to find pants that aren't too long for me. These were long both in the leg and the waist. These are very snug everywhere like others have mentioned. I ordered a size 6 because reviews said they run a little large but they were too snug around the waist for my liking.
review.name: Too long

review.reviewBody: I cannot get over how stretchy and comfortable these pants are. They really are like yoga pants, as another reviewer mentioned, except even less restricting and lighter weight/more breathable. I had a hard time trying to decide if I should keep them because they are so comfortable. However, in the end I am returning them because they are so thin and almost skin tight (which is fine for daily wear, but I needed these for work). I love this fabric though and wish I could find a design that was a little more flattering/forgiving for work-friendly attire.
review.name: Suuuper stretchy and comfortable!

review.reviewBody: I bought 2 sizes and kept them both:  the smaller size IS snug but after hours on the trail, they felt looser. In fact, the larger size started falling off my hips which required me to adjust the interior drawstring string.  They are extremely durable,  and I appreciate all the pockets, the slim leg style, and the ankle zips.  Just wish I could order the kale green in my (smaller) size.  I'll use the larger size if I wear a base layer or just casually for errands.
review.name: LOVE these

review.reviewBody: Recently purchased these pants and I?m pleasantly surprised with how comfortable they are! Perfect side cargo pocket for my phone and pants have some nice stretch. My go-to pants now that I?m WFH! Perfect for my daily hike after work with my husband and dog too. Can?t say enough about these pants, hope they hold up and wash well!
review.name: My fav pair of pants!
comment: Hey Sarah! Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review! So happy to hear you love the pants and are putting them to use in the outdoors!

review.reviewBody:
The shoes are sensitive but not too soft, and they have incredible friction on slopes! Also, the shallow heels design makes it the only shoes that I don't feel any empty heels at all. I would say Ondra Comp is (so far) the best shoe for me that wraps up my feet perfectly.

FYI I sized down from 42.5 (street shoe size) to 41.
review.name: Best climbing shoes ever!`

review.reviewBody: This is the 2nd in LaSportiva's effort to come up with a worthy competitor to the venerable Scarpa Drago. The first, the Theory, just seemed to be a hodgepodge of "technologies" that maybe confused prospective users.  The Ondra Pro is a true winner! As someone who is "heavier" that most of you, I have always wanted a soft shoe but always lamented how they would roll off smaller features due to their softness at the perimeter.  Well, the stiff "horseshoe" around the perimeter of the toe of the Ondra Pro DOES INDEED give you just enough support to stay on small features. And VOILA! If you are willing to try a full frontal "Smedge" on one of those small features, you will be shocked at how the combination of very sticky rubber and that "horseshoe" grips and cups the feature; just like Adam Ondra said it would! FWIW: There is an insinuation that maybe you should go up .5 size and that your toes do not need to be scrunched into the toe box. I disagree.  The shape of the toebox will definitely more your leverage towards your first two toes, and the sort of "thin" rubber around your toes does give somewhat, so you'll break in comfortably. Be advised, these badboys fit like a glove!  They are challenging to get into and ever more challenging to get out of; but in between, they have among the best "perfect" fit of any shoe I've ever tried on.  If you are looking for the besta-of-the-besta in a Bouldering shoe, look no further; and if you have found the Drago just a tad bit too soft for smaller features, the stiffer edge "horseshoe" inside the forefoot edge of the Ondra Comp will instill a newfound confidence in your project moves. Highly, HIGHLY recommend. Expensive and worth every penny.

review.reviewBody:
This is my favorite harness that I've ever owned. The reason why is because it's so light and compact, I never question whether or not I want to have a harness with me. I just toss it in the pack, and it disappears. When I need it, I've got it. I love how it can disappear under the hipbelt of a pack. Something that frequently irritates me with other harnesses while climbing and skiing. The packbelt, and harness are fighting for the same space and the pack ends up losing and riding up on my torso. When I'm not wearing a pack with a big belt, this harness has nice, but minimal gear loops that can hold my crevasse rescue, rappel, and other climbing gear (as long as I keep it to a minimum or rack in trees off of my carabiners.)

     For anyone who is considering purchasing this harness but is concerned that it may be too specialized, I would suggest that it's much more versatile than you might initially think. I've used the Choucas Light for alpine routes, rappels while skiing, ice climbing, summer scrambles that get a little too technical, self-evacuation from chairlifts while ski patrolling, and even glacier travel (which was probably its original intent). 

*I am an ambassador on the Blue Ice athlete team and received this product to test and use.
review.name: My favorite harness!

name: Choucas Light Harness

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've enthusiastically accumulated multiple colors of this shirt. They're soft and warm and fit great. I use them as an undershirt on cold days and a sleep shirt on cold nights. I often wear them as a stand alone depending on the weather. I hand wash them and air dry on a drying rack and they come out even softer each time they're washed.
review.name: I love these tops

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good product and good prices . I wear it for hiking .
review.name: Nice and comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for wearing every day, under everything, all winter long. Got the matching short sleeve, long sleeve, and leggings all in medium.
review.name: every day, under everything, all winter long

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these merino tops - this my second one - I out lived the former top used for running in the cold! Warm, breathable, non-smelly, easy washing. The best!
review.name: Best thermal top for running in the cold

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ordered a size L and my bust measurement is 39 inches (I am 34H in US bra sizing). I am 5'10", so I find often shirts like this are too short, but this one is perfect. The fit is snug to the body but not too tight anywhere, I can move freely and don't feel restricted at all. The fabric is silky and soft, not itchy at all, and I love the pink color. Will be wearing this on heavy repeat this winter!
review.name: The best base layer

review.reviewBody: Warm and comfy! Highly recommended!
review.name: Warm and comfy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] the oasis is my go to winter wear. every year i order 4-6 new oasis tops. this year i ordered a few black, my go to. the black reads a bit on the dark blue side. I still cherish the feel, warmth and style.
review.name: I love these oasis tops

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I already had this top in a different color and was very excited to see this shade of blue. This product is a 3 season staple for me as both a base layer and just a cute top! Would buy again!
review.name: Great color! Great top!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this top on its own for Fall, and plan to keep wearing it as a layer headed into cooler weather. Fits perfectly. For reference, I'm 5'4 and just under 120lbs.
review.name: Perfect for Fall!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I must have too many Icebreaker basic colors because I wore this color and many asked where I purchased my shirt. Would like more color choices.

review.reviewBody:
I have had three pairs of the previous version of the Quandary 10” shorts and I have worn them pretty much every day weather permitting for the last five years or so. 
Whether I am working around my place or in and out of the river on paddling trips, they were perfect for my use. 
Unfortunately, my oldest spare had several patch tears, and I decided to buy a new pair to put in rotation. I was very disappointed to find that Patagonia had shortened the zipper, change the access to the thigh pocket from top to the side where it is less secure and less accessible, and shorten the main front pockets so that my cell phone bumps my pelvis with every step and is uncomfortable when seated.   
These are still good shorts that while  I gave the old version five stars, the new version is enough of a disappointment that I could only rally for three stars.
It appears to me that it was changed just for change sake because there are certainly not functionally improved
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: Finger loops feel way more sturdy on this new model. Thumb loop is a nice add and prevented rock rash where I would typically would have gotten it. I've always loved Ocun compared to the other brands so glad they upgraded!
review.name: Better than the old model

review.reviewBody: Bought these in the blue color just to have them go on sale after I bought them. Maybe I can get a price adjustment??  Anyway, love the short. Wanted long and wondered if the 10 inch length would be enough. Seems to be the same length as Prana 11 inch shorts. As far as size is concerned, they seem to run a little big. This 36 inch waist is bigger than my Faljraven, Outdoor Research, and Black Diamond shorts.  They come in odd sizing so will get the 35 inch next time.
review.name: Super comfortable, slim look

name: Quandary 10in Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: The tongues on the shoes literally just ripped right off when I was putting them on. I've NEVER seen such awful, shoddy craftsmanship before. Absolutely terrible design.
review.name: Awful

review.reviewBody: I've been using them for almost a year on a lot of small footholds and it works like charm, very precise and great support for the foot, also the heel works amazing though a little insensitive. The one BIG problem it has is that the ball of the foot is gigantic, I can place my little finger on the side even though the toes are very crammed (but not excessively as I still wanted flexibility for smearing on credit card-like edges in less than vertical terrain); although the foot stays stable enough, is annoying that the foot moves side by side and if I wanted a tighter fit I would went with a more downturned slipper or velcro shoe for easier remove.
review.name: Far too wide but great for edging

review.reviewBody: This is a really stiff-toed shoe so it's really good on vertical climbs with small edges. but since it's so stiff, it makes smears (especially high feet smears) really sketchy. toe hooks felt really nice but I would have preferred a slightly softer heel to feel them better. I wear size 14 street shoes and got a size 13.5 but I really should have gone half a size smaller; I say this because when my feet start to sweat, my toes wouldn't stay right at the tip of the shoe. I blame part of that also on the felt that lines the inside of the shoe, it's comfortable but becomes really slippery when you sweat. The only other complaint would be that on my second session, the tongue of the left shoe fell off; most of the stitches on the tongue weren't actually connected (this didn't affect performance but it did look goofy). besides the tongue falling out, the looks of the whole shoe were superb. I got six months before the toe right above the sole rubbed away (mostly due to the smears that I was doing which are not what it's made for). overall, these shoes are really good for outdoor vertical walls and not for smears (still work, just not as well as a softer shoe). for future shoes, I would like an inside lining that's more focused on performance instead of comfort and a touch more rubber just above the toe of the shoe.
review.name: pretty dang good, just some small issues

review.reviewBody: Got these shoes as I wanted something more aggressive and blue. When they arrived I was putting them on for the first time and the right shoe's tongue ripped out as I was pulling on it to put my foot in. The shoes fit fine otherwise, and I figured it was simply a fluke. I returned the first pair and ordered another. And wouldn't ya know, the exact same thing happened the second time around. It seems odd that an aggressive shoe, which must be pulled very tight, has such weak material in the tongue. Very disappointed.
review.name: Broke when first trying it on. Twice.
comment: Hey Joseph I'm sorry those broke on you! I will be reaching out via email shortly to try and remedy this.

review.reviewBody: Love the fit and feel of the shoe. Heal fit is really good.  Tried them at a demo and got the size right.  They broke in and are just what I was looking for.  A comfortable but snug and high performance shoe I can wear even on long routes.  Leather upper feels good and stretched a little which is great as I went a 1/2 size down from my street shoe.  Love it on granite and sandstone, not so much on plastic and slick limestone.
review.name: Breaks in nice!

review.reviewBody: Loving the new Geshido Lace.  Fit is great and sized it the same as my street shoe size.  Could have gone down a 1/2 size if I wanted it for bouldering/gym shoe.  But street shoe size, it's comfortable and I can keep it on for multi-pitch and long routes.   Leather upper melted to my foot shape pretty quickly and it's really comfy but still high performance a shoe.
review.name: Great all rounder

review.reviewBody:
Let's start off with the good news: this shoe is a good fit for people with a wide forefoot and narrow heel looking for an asymmetrical shoe that doesn't bend the big toe distally. Street shoe size is was spot on for a snug but not uncomfortable fit. I am glad to see companies catering more for the wide forefoot/narrow heel foot shape since most shoes on the market pander to a narrow, Egyptian style foot shape. 
Now to the execution: this shoe utterly fails at being comfortable and supportive on multipitch applications for two reasons. 1. It is not nearly stiff or suppotive enough. The toes turn upwards significantly when standing on an edge. 2. Upward deformation of the toes tensions the slingshot rand, clamping down on the base of the Achilles tendon, causing instant discomfort to those suffering from bursitis.
If this shoe were significantly stiffer, used a firmer rubber compound, and used an underfoot active randing tensioning system to resist upward deformation of the toes, it would get 5 stars. However, it is useless and painful for its intended application. There are plenty of great, softer, downturned shoes for overhung climbing. 
By trying to be good at everything, this shoe ends up bring good at nothing. Look elsewhere for a stiff, cambered edging shoe.
review.name: Master of None

name: Geshido Lace Climbing Shoe

description: Buy the Ultimate Direction Utility Belt online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Utility Belt
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ultimate Direction Utility Belt online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Horrible belt that’s very uncomfortable to wear. The 2 elastic loops to presumably hold your trekking poles are so big, their elastic function it’s worthless since they cannot wrap tightly to trekking poles let alone anything else less bulky. It also runs big. On top of that, I can’t return it because Backcountry charges a ridiculous fee of $7.99 to process the return, meaning it makes no sense since I’d be losing money. Do not buy this belt, it’s a waste of money.
review.name: Poorly designed belt

review.reviewBody: I bought a small because my waist is 27 inches, but it is not anywhere near enough stretchy to fit over my 38 inch hips. Because of how little stretch the material has, I don't think sizing up would help because then it would be too floppy around the waist. I'm sure it's great if you have slim runner hips!
review.name: not good if you have wide hips

review.reviewBody:
I was skeptical when i bought this that it would actually hold what i wanted it to hold, and still be comfortable while running. Im happy to say that it exceeds expectations in both categories!

What did I want it to hold? Good question! I actually got this as a solution to carrying dog stuff (collapsible bowl, 500ml softflask, snack bag of dog treats, a few shitbags and hand sanitizer, gu/energy chews, my phone, headphone case, and keys) and it works like gangbusters to keep things all together and organized in the 4 total pockets. I typically dont fill the flask all the way as it fits better about 3/4, and doesn't put pressure on the bite valve preventing leaking. 

With it all loaded and situated where it needs to be it really keeps things in place and with the flask in it does have some bounce, but ultimately less than another UD belt ive had. For runs where I dont need the flask in it it pretty much doesnt bounce at all, and again less than an different belt ive used from them. Little loops above the pockets make them easy to find and pull open to get at whatever you need. Ive also used them to clip the dog bowl or a pair of gloves to. Havent used the elastic straps for trekking poles yet but its a nice place to loop a layer through if you need to drop a layer. 

Can be worn under or over clothing, i wear it under and havent had any issues chafing wearing it next to skin. Easy machine wash too! Overall really pleased with this, had it out for up to 12 miles fully loaded (w/flask) and think its a great vest alternative for cooler weather or shorter runs.
review.name: Better than expected ..

name: Utility Belt

hasVariant.name: Sonic 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Sonic 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sonic 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Sonic 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased the 0 degree bag for a bike-to-ski trip in Iceland, so I needed it to work in a variety of conditions (cold, wet, snowy, windy, you name it), and be versatile enough to pack into panniers, backpacks, and beyond. The bag was perfect and outperformed my expectations.

I stayed warm on cold nights and loved the ability to open the gills for added breathability, which was crucial in never feeling too swampy if it was a warm night. I ended up swapping the stock stuff sack for a waterproof compression sack, and it packed down quite small for a 0 degree, fitting well into my panniers and 35L backpack when skiing.

I'm 5'9" and the regular length fit me well - my pillow tucked very nice and snugly into the hood, so sleeping was always quite comfy and cozy.

No complaints, issues, etc. Happy customer here!
review.name: Best 0 Degree Bag I've Owned!

review.reviewBody:
The Nemo Sonic 0 Degree Sleeping Bag is a neutral performer. While the Nemo Sonic 0 Degree Sleeping Bag has awesome features and the best draft tube I have ever tested, it still did was not in the top percentile of all the sleeping bags I have tested. Using USDA certified thermometers, it only got up to 79 degrees on the inside of the bag. When compared to Therm-A-Rest Parsec, Feathered Friends Ibis ES and Mountain Hardware Bishop Pass GoreTex, it was well below those bags 82+ degree performances. Budget or expensive, it was just meh in terms of warmth performance. 

With all that being said, the Nemo Sonic 0 Degree Sleeping Bag would most likely work well from 10 degrees up to 40 degrees since it has the venting option. But I would not take it below 10 degrees. Also, if you are 5'11" or above, do not get the regular. I am 6' and it was short for me, causing my feet to be cold at 8 degrees.
review.name: Meh Performance at 0 Degrees

review.reviewBody: Worked perfectly for a fall bear hunt in Alaska. I am 6’1” and purchased the XL and in was nice with a little length to spare.
review.name: Fall in Alaska

review.reviewBody:
I bought this in time for my 4 day solo backcountry hunt. Temperatures were projected to be in the mid teens at night, but a cold snap occurred and dropped down to single digits (Fahrenheit). This bag saved my trip. It was so warm that I was able to sleep in my boxers. I'm 6'2" tall and 230 pounds. The long bag allowed for plenty of space to move freely. My size 14 feet didn't feel cramped in the toe box. Condensation in the morning was easily brushed off with a towel in the morning and the bag always dried quickly. I don't think the insulation ever got wet. The baffle cinches with an elastic cord and traps in the heat. The gills did a great job of regulating heat. I think it packs down to a reasonable size with the stuff sack, and I think the stuff sack was well-matched. I don't believe I could have compressed the bag much more. There's a pocket near the zipper, just below the face opening. This fit my Iphone 12 mini, but I don't think it would fit anything much larger.

I have suggestions for the design in the future. Because of the wallet/phone pocket's location, in the morning, it was usually covered with condensation. This made trying to open the pocket only slightly more difficult, but was still annoying to deal with the cold and damp. It's also not accessible unless I were to open the main zipper and let out heat. I'd prefer a pouch, interior to the bag. This way it's insulated from freezing temperatures. The baffle velcro could be a bit stronger too, or designed to sandwich between flaps for better purchase. But these are very minor issues. What matters most is that the bag is warm, roomy, dry, and of a reasonable weight and pack size. Having this bag has opened up so many more opportunities for cold weather outtings that I cannot wait to explore.
review.name: Outstanding sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: Very warm, just the right amount of room for me, zipper works very well, thermal gills work great. I have been sleeping in bags for 60 years and this is my favorite
review.name: I like everything about this bag

review.reviewBody: Do not take this out for anything less than 30F. You will be cold. There?s no way this is a lower limit of 0F. Lower limit of 15, maybe, and I?d imagine I would be shivering. This is a 30F bag all day every day. The baffles are 2.5? thick. Something is seriously wrong with these bags.
review.name: This is not a 0 degree bag.

name: Sonic 0 Sleeping Bag: 0F Down

review.reviewBody: These are the only sandals I've found that are perfectly comfortable for my foot with a slight bunion... and it sort of disguises it. The midform height means I don't get debris kicking up into the footbed which always happens with flats.
review.name: Perfect height and perfectly comfortable

review.reviewBody: I wore these urban hiking around Florence, Italy and could not have been happier. It's been a while since I owned a pair of Teva's and now I can't remember why I went with any other sandal. Wore them for hours and miles at a time. Great shoe. Adjustable straps helped as the day wore on and my feet started to swell.
review.name: Could not live without them!

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes. I wish I could have every pair!
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: I love these sandals. They were comfortable right out of the box. I wore them several hours the first day. I was able to adjust them perfectly with the adjustable straps. They give me the perfect amount of support, which is what I was looking for. The second time I wore them was for an entire day, and it did not even begin to irritate my plantar faciitis, which I am prone to. If I needed a second pair, would buy them in a heartbeat.
review.name: Love these sandals

review.reviewBody: I like this sandal because it is simple and my feet are cool. The best part is the toe strap and ankle strap are both Velcro and adjustable. I have wide feet and these sandals are comfortable.
review.name: I would buy this sandal again

review.reviewBody: Sorry to say I have nothing negative. I love these sandals love love, love... What comfort!
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: I bought before a trip to Nashville for a concert. No break-in period needed. Walked 5 miles in them the first day and almost 9 miles second. In addition stood at the concert in them for 5 hours. No blisters, no issues at all. Great purchase!
review.name: Super sandals!!

review.reviewBody: I have flat feet and have a hard time finding shoes of any kind that fit well and feel good. I'm really happy to have found another pair of sandals that I can wear all day. They are so comfortable!
review.name: So very comfy

review.reviewBody: I wear them every day in summer, in the house or walking in the woods. I have one black pair and 2 sand colored pairs from last year. I wzz as sh them in a pail with ECOS dish soap and a scrubie. They clean up great, hold there shape and are so comfortable on your feet. Love them. Thankful for the free shipping!!!
review.name: I would buy, and I did. this product 3 times.

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love my tevas and wear them all the time. I find them to be pretty comfy. The only negative thing that I have to say about them is that both soles on each pair came apart shortly after wearing them.
review.name: Love, but soles ripped apart shortly after wearing them

name: Midform Universal Sandal - Women's
