hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Soelden 42L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Used as a quiver of one for ski day trips, short overnights, and technical summer daytrips for a year of heavy use. In general the pack worked ok, but definitely has some flaws. A 40L pack without a decent internal frame is hard to understand. Fully loaded with skis, boots, skins, crampons, ski crampons, rope, rack, helmet, ice axe, etc. the pack carries very poorly. Other flaws include the flapjack cover being non removable and getting in the way when using the brain, bad diagonal ski carry system, weak buckles prone to breaking, bad ice axe carry system, and lots of confusing and unnecessary straps. The pack has lots of unnecessary features while still missing a few important ones. Compared to similar bags it is also quite heavy. Overall a decent bag that is spacious and durable, but carries load poorly and has a poorly thought out feature set.
review.name: Decent pack but has flaws

review.reviewBody: I’m about two months into using this pack 4 days a week for working ski patrol and as of now I’m blown away. I will say I find myself not using the full valume available but I’m stoked I went for the 42 over the 30 because then I need the extra space it’s so nice to just loosen the straps and fit everything I need for long days out on the snow. I can not recommend this pack enough for any situation where bringing gear out for long days in the snow is needed. If your just looking for a pack to take with you on short trips to the snow the 30 will probably be enough for you but if you want a pack which can do it all I’d stick to the 42. The only thing I’d change is I’d have a second retaining strap for the brain retention strap as It would just make the straps a little nicer for when you don’t have much in the pack
review.name: Ski Patrol

review.reviewBody:
This is a great snow pack. No doubt about it. The snow shedding back panel, organization, and weather resistant materials make this ideal for skiing, boarding, and snowshoeing! However, we actually frequently use this to carry our photography equipment. The whole back panel can unzip to the base! This gives you great access to larger more fragile equipment. We just place a padded insert in the bag to keep the equipment protected, and love the wide opening. This is obviously meant for getting better access to equipment while putting the snow/water proof material 'face' of the bag on the snow, but it's a versatile function that we love.
The straps which allow for A-frame ski carry and snowboard carry is useful for more equipment as long as you are creative! We've carried tripods, snowshoes, poles, and more with them.
review.name: Snow Specific Pack with Surprising Versatility

name: Soelden 42L Backpack

review.itemreviewed: Helio Fixed Length Carbon Ski Poles
review.reviewBody: One of the poles broke in half during a simple pole plant on my very first day of use. They may be light, but they are frail and useless.
review.name: Broke my first day out

review.itemreviewed: Helio Fixed Length Carbon Ski Poles
review.reviewBody: Well into my second season w these poles. I?m not really a touring nerd, weight-weenie  kinda skier, more  50/50 w as many resort days as touring. They serve me extremely well in various conditions. Been well used and lovingly abused. Took some getting used to, as I couldn?t tell if I was holding poles at first - sans straps for me. Imma thinking I?ll grab a second pair for storage since they?re still on sale? Would hate for these to be discontinued and force me back to lugging around something heavier. =)
review.name: Light and bomber. Never going back now.

review.itemreviewed: Helio Fixed Length Carbon Ski Poles
review.reviewBody: These feel too good to be true. And they are. Both my wife and I bought them and both our sets broke after a few uses. Mine broke while clipping out of my skis right above the tip. Her's broke right in the middle when she fell. I'd say they are good option for when you need the lightest gear, but then, when do you need the lightest gear and don't need it to work? Just don't bother.
review.name: Very light, very fragile

review.itemreviewed: 303 Firecrest Carbon Disc Brake Wheel - Tubeless
review.reviewBody: Coming from Roval Terra wheels to these. Running a set of these on my gravel bike. Love the engagement and durability... to say the least. Pretty light and easy to mount. Running anything from 38 - 44 on these.
review.name: USE FOR GRAVEL = AWESOME

review.itemreviewed: 303 Firecrest Carbon Disc Brake Wheel - Tubeless
review.reviewBody: Conti GP 5000S TR (28) are so tight, that I found myself straining and swearing to get the tires on the rims.  Tires inflated with just a track pump. Tire fitting aside, the wheels do not disappoint.   The Zipps spin up fast and are fairly stiff.  Thanks to the wide internal width, I’m running only 52 and 56 psi which removes a lot of road chatter.  I switched over from Bontrager Aeolus 37 Pros and for about the same depth (37 v 40), the Zipp wheels feel a faster.
review.name: Great wheels

review.itemreviewed: 303 Firecrest Carbon Disc Brake Wheel - Tubeless
review.reviewBody: It is not clear when buying, but this is only a rear wheel. When you search for Zipp 303 Firecrest on this website, this is the only listing. You have the option to select hubs, and in the product description it gives the total weight of the wheel SET. However, when the box arrived, there was only a rear wheel. This is extremely confusing, especially because the reviews all talk about the "wheels", not "wheel". Furthermore, there is no product page for the front wheel, which, if it existed, would have at least made me suspect that I wasn't going to receive 2 wheels. Alas, this wheel will be returned.
review.name: NOT a wheel SET - only a rear wheel!

review.itemreviewed: 303 Firecrest Carbon Disc Brake Wheel - Tubeless
review.reviewBody: I love my new wheels. The Firecreset is prefect for a comfortable long ride.  My only observation is that the wheel bearings seem to be very slow.  In comparison to the OEM DT Swiss wheels, these Firecrest rotate about half as many times as the DT Swiss ones.  Maybe even a third as many revolutions.  Too much friction INHO.
review.name: Almost Perfect…however

review.itemreviewed: 303 Firecrest Carbon Disc Brake Wheel - Tubeless
review.reviewBody: These wheels are very light, they almost feel fragile being this light. I needed to wet the tire bead with a little soapy water to help slide it over the rim and I was able to get it mounted without much trouble. Note that there are two drain holes in the rim, you can't see them in the pics. Those holes were not finished smoothly as they had a some carbon splinters, both rims were like this. SRAM confirmed that two holes is normal. I was able to seat 42 mm tires just using a floor pump, on the first try. No compressor needed. These definitely roll a lot faster than the aluminum WTB ST wheels that came with my bike. And the freehub is not very noisy either. I only have a couple rides so I can't speak to durability but so far I like the ride.
review.name: Light, pretty easy to mount tires

review.itemreviewed: 303 Firecrest Carbon Disc Brake Wheel - Tubeless
review.reviewBody: Bought a set of the new 303 Firecrest to use as road wheels on my gravel bike.  I've put several hundred miles on them now and really, really like them.  As they are hookless, getting my tires to pop onto the rims took a little more effort than I was accustomed to.  But once I got the tires to set on the rims, they've been solid so far.
review.name: Great wheels!

review.itemreviewed: 303 Firecrest Carbon Disc Brake Wheel - Tubeless
review.reviewBody:
I have been riding these wheels for about two months now and I feel that I can provide some insight into how they perform.

Installation: After receiving the wheels I installed a pair of 28 mm SCHWALBE Pro One Evolution tires. The tires mounted without the need for an air compressor and inflated with a floor pump. Both wheels showed some leakage around the valve stems initially but this quickly sealed when the Stan's sealant was injected and there were no issues with their holding air subsequently. This is the 5th tubeless installation that I have performed and it was by far the easiest.

Performance: I was initially skeptical regarding the tire pressures recommended by Zipp for these wheels. For a rider of my weight, around 200 pounds, pressure of 65 psi in the rear and 60 psi in the front are recommended. As it turns out these pressures work very well. The 28 mm tires have taken on a very low and wide profile and dampen vibration and grip well with no squirming suggestive of inadequate inflation. After about 800 miles of riding I have had zero punctures. The freewheel is loud and I like the sound. There have been no issues with the hubs so far. Initially the bearings seemed sluggish, but after a few hundred miles they spin well. The wheels have remained true despite some punishment and appear to have been built well. I am unable to comment on the claims regarding power savings due to the improved compliance but I will say that the wheels feel fast. This is especially noticeable on chipseal roads and broken road surfaces, where there is a sensation of giving up less energy to the road than with other wheels that I have used. The wheels perform well in crosswinds despite their medium depth.

Overall impressions: I think that this is an excellent wheelset and a great choice for the type of long distance riding that I do, where the compliance is very much appreciated. They look great. They are not inexpensive but I think that they are a good value given the quality and should last for many years.
review.name: Fantastic wheels
comment: Was curious... is the minimum tire width 28mm? Can I use 25mm with these wheels?  thanks.

name: 303 Firecrest Carbon Disc Brake Wheel - Tubeless

review.reviewBody: I bought these mittens to replace a pair I had from a brand that no longer exists. My initial impression was that they were going to be way too warm on the mountain, especially with the liner glove. But, lo, the first few weeks of the season have had some below-15 temperatures, so these have been perfect for the conditions, even without slipping a handwarmer in the back-of-hand pocket. My hands have been super dry and cozy, and the liner gloves are awesome for getting boots on and the rest of my kit set up while in the parking lot. Warmer days might call for a lighter mitt (or just the liner glove?), but for the icy days I've had so far, these mittens are doing their job.
review.name: Too warm... Or are they?

review.reviewBody: This is my first pair of mittens and I?m very happy with them. They?re warm, great fit, and liner helps keep away any moister. The price point is amazing! And the quality is there. Used in sub-freezing temps and my hands were warm!
review.name: Mittens

review.reviewBody: These are cute mittens, loved the idea of them being wind/water resistant. Unfortunately, even with the inside liner gloves, my fingers get really, really cold while out on dog walks when the temps get below about 30F. They would probably work much better for someone doing active winter sports where you work up some body heat. You know, like snowboarding (which was clearly stated in the description yet I chose to ignore that bit of information).
review.name: Not great for dog walking below 30F

review.reviewBody: Great mittens, helped keep my hands warm. Not too bulky but still thick.
review.name: Keeps warm

name: GORE-TEX Mitten - Women's

review.reviewBody: I love this puffy blanket! The compact size and carry bag makes it a perfect travel blanket.
review.name: Cozy and warm!

review.reviewBody: We love our new Rumpl blanket, we bought the 2 person and it’s perfect for my wife and I. Lightweight and packs down in our river dry bag
review.name: River blanket

review.reviewBody: I’ve been a lover of Rumpl blankets for years. I have multiple colors and sizes and love them all. I bought this one specifically for a road trip where I was going to be carrying lots of musical gear in my SUVV for a show (Toyota 4Runner). I bought the black color 2-man size so I can cover my load in the back so prying eyes won’t be able to see even through the 5% tint I have in the back. And sure enough, even in direct sunlight, you can see the seats but my equipment was covered in the back and all you see is black. I am not trying to encourage people to leave stuff in their cars. I think people should be responsible with what they keep in their cars. For this review, I just want to say, “Great Product!” Great for camping, road trips, also camouflaging. 🤣. Highly recommend!
review.name: Best blanket with multiple uses

review.reviewBody: This a was a great addition to the camping gear. Whether you're on the beach, in the woods or up the side of a mountain, this kept me warm.
review.name: Lots of warmth in a small package

review.reviewBody: After getting my first Rumpl for Christmas last year, I knew my partner and I needed a double puffy blanket as an upgrade to our rooftop tent setup. I always have to bundle up when we camp because I get so cold in the Colorado mountains. The first night we used the double at around 11,000’ elevation, I was FINALLY warm! I even woke up and took off a layer because the Rumpl kept us nice and toasty. We ended up replacing our 20* sleeping bags with the Rumpl original puffy plus a thin wool blanket. The two keep us warmer than our sleeping bags alone did. Definitely recommend the Rumpl as a camp staple!
review.name: A Camping Staple

review.reviewBody: It’s as soft as a baby kitten. Plus it keeps me warm. Purr!
review.name: Soft Kitty

review.reviewBody: Loved ours so much, I bought as a gift for my nephew who camps all the time!
review.name: Love this blankie

review.reviewBody: I was gifted this blanket when rumpl first began, I believe about ten years ago. I have used it religiously ever since, and there is not a single stain or thread loose - it looks like it could be new.
review.name: Still looks new

review.reviewBody: I think I bought 7 now and gave to special people in my life for camping or travel. They Love them and I love mine. I am just spending time at my daughter's and so I have mine with me. Going home today, pack in nice bag and easy to fit in car. Love it.
review.name: Puffy Blanket

review.reviewBody: I carry my Rumpl in my trunk and have used if for kids outdoor sporting events and cabin life. I love it so much!
review.name: Best blanket

review.reviewBody: These are so awesome. They are very comfortable and warm. They look great, too.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: These pants are my go-to for chilly camping, cabin nights, apres ski, or cozy lounging. I am 5’2” and 115 lbs and the XS fits great, loose but not baggy. We all have fleece jackets, this is the pants version of your favorite fleece sweatshirt. Plus the extra fabric over the knees to make them more durable.
review.name: Cozy pants for camping

review.reviewBody:
Purchases an xs so they'd be tight to wear under ski pants on very cold days.  I'm 5'4" /120 lbs with a curvy figure and they fit well.  So far i've only worn them around the house and they are noticeably warmer than cotton sweatpants.  
I was anticipating having to get them hem'd to work with a ski boot, but I think they can fold up enough to stay out of the boot.  TBD, but it looks promising.  They really should make a 3/4 length and market it to skiers.
review.name: Base layer for the extra cold days

review.reviewBody: I don't ever write reviews, but I love MH gear and so wanted to say that while the fabric on these pants feels wonderfully soft and warm, the thick fabric bunches at the crotch because of the way the garment is sewn.  I tried both the small and the medium because I am often between sizes, and the problem was the same with both sizes.  I wanted to love these pants but I couldn't get past the bunching, so I sent both sizes back.  Please, MH, fix this issue and I'll gladly repurchase these.  Bonus points if you take the same fabric currently on the knees of the pants and add this to the seat as well.
review.name: Weird Bunching You Know Where

review.reviewBody: For my figure, they're just a little too short in the crotch. That said, I'm older and my waistline has migrated. I'm 5'3", 120 lbs, and they fit good otherwise. I've only worn them once and only for a few minutes. I was standing around in the snow, waiting to extricate a vehicle from the mud, and I was immediately toasty warm. They deserve five stars for someone with a lower waistline.
review.name: If You Want Warm...!

review.reviewBody: I have 3 pair of these.  They are so warm and cozy. Better than any other pair of sweats or leggings I own!
review.name: Warm and so cozy!

review.reviewBody:
Wearing them since day 1: love them with all gratitude. MH is always true to size (XS), and true to their quality.

These paths I love beyond all for their cozy feel, almost toasty warmth, beautiful look and - given every day heavy duty wear for full two months by now - unbelievable durability.
(Well, I have another MH polartec product that’s been in use for 8 years and still looks great, so it shouldn’t be a surprise:)

So: wanted to buy an extra pair, but my size is now out of stock. 

Use:
Every day indoor, outdoor: total daily wearing time is 12-14 hours (I work from home).
review.name: Best of the best

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these, they are so warm and comfortable!
review.name: Warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I don’t know where to start with these, comfiest thing I've ever owned. I live in NW Washington and freeze in any temperature less that 70 degrees, so i was looking for something to keep me warm this winter and these are them 100%. I disagree with all the reviews saying these are high waisted, I would say they’re midwaist, sitting bellow the belly button. I’m 5’9” and 125lbs so i went with the XS Long and they fit perfectly. Im not sure how it would be for the girls over 5’11” though since i didn't have much extra fabric at the ankle. They even somehow make my butt look good? Which i wasn't expecting. I think if your unsure size down. Just hoping they keep restocking so i can buy more and maybe add an ‘extra long’ option for my fellow tall girlies who want to keep their entire leg warm lol.
review.name: Not a want a need

review.reviewBody: I am stunned at how warm these are. I’ve worn a pair of polar fleece old navy pants for years and these are insanely warmer. I knew they would be but not to this extent. Totally worth the price!
review.name: Soooo warm

name: Polartec High Loft Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: After a couple of hikes I can say I love these shoes. Material is more dense and supportive than On running shoes. Material cleans easily too. Very cushioned and comfortable. Probably not made for serious climbing over rocks and such, but great on light to moderate trails.
review.name: Love these shoes!

review.reviewBody: I’ve only had these sneakers for a few months, and they’ve already started making an annoying squishy, rubbery sound every time I walk. It’s incredibly frustrating and makes them feel cheap. Definitely not worth the money—save yourself the trouble and pick a different pair!
review.name: Tearable sneakers

review.reviewBody:
The first item I ordered was used. The color I ordered ended up being out of stock so Backcountry was great and issued me a replacement in a different color after returning the crusty green cooler.

Unfortunately after a couple of months with extreme light use indoors, as a dry cooler, the replacement is showing extreme signs of wear making me believe this will not hold-up with elements outdoors. I'm not happy with my purchase and I wouldn't recommend this brand. The cooler is a crusty mess.
review.name: not a fan of the brand

review.itemreviewed: Rosso Corsa Pro V Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: I had to exchange the gloves for size. The customer support at the Seattle Store was excellent. The staff and manager were courteous and made every effort to help. Keep up the good work!!
review.name: Great Customer Support

review.itemreviewed: Rosso Corsa Pro V Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Very sleek and well vented for sweaty hands. I like that it has  sticky rubber and the cloth material both.  Most are just cloth.  The padding is pretty good. I do wish it was thicker but it works.  Mine lasted for about 4 months of consistent riding before they started to wear out. 
I would get them again for sure.  They are made to fit tight and snug . The sizing is correct
review.name: I love them

review.itemreviewed: Rosso Corsa Pro V Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, breathes well, good padding for me. Difficult to get off, I feel like eventually this is why it will wear out early, from struggling to get it off after every ride. But for the time being I am happy with it and for the $45 it cost I will definitely get my moneys worth out of it.
review.name: good glove

review.itemreviewed: Rosso Corsa Pro V Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have purchased Castelli product before so I knew to size up, and yes it can be difficult to take off a sweaty hand. I still like the glove very much because it provides great ventilation on the top of glove and sufficient (not too much) padding on the palm of the glove. It is the best combination of weight, breathability and cushioning that I have found.
review.name: Very Good Glove But Not Perfect

review.itemreviewed: Rosso Corsa Pro V Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: It indeed runs small so need to size up. I pretty like the glove, but I think it kinda takes a little bit time to break it. My first ride with it caused a little pain on my right purlicue, but that didn't happen after that.
review.name: It runs small

review.itemreviewed: Rosso Corsa Pro V Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm an XL in every glove I've ever worn and can barely get my hand in an XL. It's very snug ever around the finger and there's no pull tab of any kind to remove. I actually liked the padding, but these are going back.
review.name: Runs small. Hard to get on and off.

review.itemreviewed: Rosso Corsa Pro V Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Have been using these 3-4 days a week for four months now. No loose stitching or split seams to report. They have handled numerous runs through the washing machine well. Size runs slightly small. Warm enough to the high 50s. 

Only complaints: padding not very good. On rides of 2-3 hours or more I often get pinch/rub in between the the thumb and index finger pads, causing irritation almost like a blister. 

Would not purchase again.
review.name: Good quality, durable, could be better

review.itemreviewed: Rosso Corsa Pro V Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nothing to write home about - kind of flimsy, afraid it I might tear it just putting it on.  Got the L and about a size too small.  Gonna stick with the trusty old Giros.
review.name: Absolutely meh for the price...
comment: Yeh have loved these in the past ,I bought extra large  and they are  still too snug. Also I preferred  the older slip on version. Gloves are so hard I want quality  and fit what  is so hard?

name: Rosso Corsa Pro V Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Purchased these for a backcountry winter hut trip in the Rockies. They kept my feet dry and very warm. So comfy after wearing ski boots all day. I'll be wearing these near home to walk the dog.
review.name: Great buy

review.reviewBody: These slippers not only feel amazing but are sooo warm! They are the best for post ski days and hanging out at home on cold nights. The grip on the bottom of the boots is so amazing and work on snow and ice. This item is perfect for anyone with chronic cold feet or those looking for a post ski day slipper. Don’t sleep on these, get a pair for yourself and you’ll want to wear them everyday!! I know I will be!
review.name: Warm cozy, exactly what I was looking for this winter!!

review.reviewBody: I work at a PNW ski resort where it is very cold and sometimes wet and these shoes keep me warm and dry all day. I wear them outside in the snow and the rain (not for extended periods of time) and they stand up to the elements really well. And they have a great cushion so they are incredibly comfortable.
They are so warm and I have poor circulation, I’ve searched my entire life for these!
review.name: Warm!

review.reviewBody: Exactly what we were looking for, and perfectly executed.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Bought these because they were half off. Thin synthetic filling not warm enough for Canadian outdoor weather. The booties barely have any support for feet, loses its shape easily and not comfortable for walking
review.name: Disappointed purchase

review.reviewBody: Love these! So comfortable, feels like waking on cloud. So cute I didn't want to dirty them on my last camping trip! (LOL)  But I know they can withstand it.
review.name: Love! Super Cute

review.reviewBody:
I bought the green pair and love them. I already have camp booties that don’t have a heavy sole and I really like them, but wanted something with a bit of tread to use for leaving the van at night. These fit the bill and more! They are really cute, go on fairly easily and keep your feet warm and toasty — even without socks. 

I wear a women’s size 10 and the L fit very well. They a little snug but I assume they will stretch a bit with time.
review.name: I love these!

review.reviewBody: These seem great! I have extremely cold feet, so look forward to camping with these. They're a bit too heavy for backpacking but are lightweight with a sturdy sole that will be great for car camping
review.name: Excellent warmth

review.reviewBody: I bought these for camping, haven't gone camping yet (plan to this weekend) but they are so great that I've been wearing them around the house non-stop! They are comfortable, warm, and it's super convenient if I need to step outside for a moment!
review.name: Love these to keep my feet toasty!

name: Tundra Trax Bootie - Women's

description: Buy the Deuter Futura Air Trek SL 45+10L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Futura Air Trek SL 45+10L Backpack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Deuter Futura Air Trek SL 45+10L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Futura Air Trek SL 45+10L Backpack - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I couldn't be happier! My new Deuter Future Air Trek works so well! I love how comfortable if feels on my body. I had a lot of weight in my backpack, but you couldn't even tell! It is PERFECT for long treks. You guys should get one!
review.name: My favorite trekking backpack!

review.itemreviewed: Futura Air Trek SL 45+10L Backpack - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag has pockets for your pockets! 
The one and only issue we have is the teen this was bought for (who is not a tiny child) can't strap the waist strap tightly like they would like. There is a good amount of space, probably wouldn't be an issue for colder months use when wearing bulkier gear. 
It is very comfortable when packed. I think I can fit this kids whole room in here. Comes with water proof cover which will of course be forgotten but it's there. Says lifetime warranty which is good since this one is for a teen. 
The kid approves so everyone is happy.
review.name: This bag is huge

review.itemreviewed: Futura Air Trek SL 45+10L Backpack - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This backpack is great! It holds the weight evenly and while I was only out for a few hours I had no issues with it at all. It is very comfortable and the elastic spring steel really helped with keeping the sweat on my back to a minimum. There are so many pockets, and it comes with a tarp to cover the backpack if it rains. The straps are all super adjustable which makes it even more comfortable. I really appreciated the cushions  on the lower hip straps, they helped immensely. Great backpack, super comfortable, and lots of storage and loops to hang things
review.name: So comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Futura Air Trek SL 45+10L Backpack - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this earlier this month for a camping trip. I was able to pack a week's worth of clothing in addition to water and some dehydrated food. Not only was it able to carry everything I needed, it was so comfortable! I hiked 8 miles a day and almost forgot I was  wearing the backpack at times.
review.name: Comfortable and Roomy backpack!

review.itemreviewed: Futura Air Trek SL 45+10L Backpack - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We used this backp this weekend.  We are avid hikers throughout our national parks. We are always looking for a lightweight yet versatile pack to take with us. This one was comfortable with the waist straps as well as firm backing.   There are lots of spaces to pack essentials
review.name: Amazing

review.itemreviewed: Futura Air Trek SL 45+10L Backpack - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great item as expected! Good craftsmenship and relatively light weight!
There are many loops on the outside for more luggage attachments! The large compartment can be opened from the outside in several places. So you don't have to empty everything out to get to items at the very bottom! Great feature! The shoulder straps are super flexible. Reminds me of a ruck sack but a much more compact version that the Army offers!
Value for money is ok!
review.name: Awesome bag!

review.itemreviewed: Futura Air Trek SL 45+10L Backpack - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love this back pack. It is perfect for camping or hiking especially. There is so much room on it and it's so easy to carry.  I love the straight back it has. It helps with packing ut and it causes less back pain for me. I would definitely recommend it to anyone
review.name: Great product

review.itemreviewed: Futura Air Trek SL 45+10L Backpack - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Futura Air Trek 45 + 10 SL is versatile and comfortable. It is very comfortable over their shoulders and the weight of the pack is not overbearing. The pack is made out of very high quality material. From immediate inspection, you can easily see and feel how well made the pack is made. Adjusting for different girths and lengths is very easy to do. The compartments are intelligently placed and are good sizes. It's back friendly and I love the hip fins. I am very pleased with this pack.
review.name: Versatile and comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Futura Air Trek SL 45+10L Backpack - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If I could give this backpack 10 stars I definitely would.  This is the most durable, amazing backpack that I've ever owned.  I have owned a few backpacks in my day where my fiance and I love to go hiking and camping.  None of them even compare to the Deuter Futura Air Trek.  And what's even better is that it's designed for women!!!!!!  
Deuter is an all around amazing brand. If something happens to your pack they promise to repair it free or charge!!  How amazing is that??
The Future Air Trek SL is so comfortable.  It adjusts to fit any body type and it keeps you well ventilated which is amazing in those hot temperatures.
The SL version is for women like me who have short backs.  I'm a short bodied woman and this backpack is the perfect size for me!! 
You will never have to worry about packing multiple bags again.  This pack has so many places for storing items that it's unbelievable.  And everything is perfectly ventilated so that if you have to pack up your wet clothing or anything with moisture in it you won't have to worry about it ruining because there is plenty of ventilation.  
You will never have to worry about packing lightly.  You can fit all of your needs into this amazing backpack for a long distance trip and never have to worry about anything else.  If you haven't purchased this pack you should give it a try.  The price is a little on the expensive side but for good reason!  This company is amazing and so are their products.  My fiance is going to order a backpack for himself soon!!!
review.name: Amazing Hiking Backpack!!!!!!!

review.itemreviewed: Futura Air Trek SL 45+10L Backpack - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This backpack is amazing.  It's great for hiking and to carry you camping gear in.   It has a lot of room in it.   I love the multiple zippers to get in the bag from top bottom or front.   It's sturdy and light weight
review.name: Great backpack

name: Futura Air Trek SL 45+10L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody:
The dark yellow jacket shown in pic is actually a pumpkin orange color in real life. The fit is very long in the arms and normal/short where it rests on the hips; it is also a little wide at the hips so may not be good for preventing cold from coming in from the bottom of the jacket. Overall, the fit is maybe a little too boxy, and could benefit from having a more natural shape. I am returning for those reasons. 
However, the fleece was softer and a more manageable thickness for being active, than some other polyester fleeces that feel scratchy and bulky. You would want to layer this in colder climates.
review.name: Color and Fit

review.reviewBody:

review.name: MSR Reactor 1.7 L Deep Dish Bowl

review.reviewBody:
I agree with what Nicholas wrote, quoted below; the plates and bowls lose utility due to fact they do not nest in one another. Whether camping, or at home, each plate or bowl takes up space and cannot be stacked into each other. Not even the heaviest dishware I know of has that problem. MSR is one of the most important outdoor gear companies, manufacturing the best stoves, and other gear. Cookwear also the best available. These plates and bowls are great, but, not being able to stack them is a real detractor. I bought three each of a two bowls and plates, am glad I did, but, they take up the space of like 20 full size bowls or plates in my kitchen cabinet. Presumably MSR has considered this and determined that the product is best as is, maybe ? Personally, I vote for nesting/stackable versions, similar to any old school tupperware. 

"NicholasVerified Buyer
1.0 star rating
08/13/20

review.itemreviewed: XC502 Limited Edition Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
It took three pairs of these shoes to finally find the right fit. Based on my experience, I recommend sizing-up, especially if you are in-between the available sizes.

I have had great luck with other brands, especially Giro, but I wanted to try something new. This is my first pair of shoes with a BOA system and I'm pleased with the results. The build quality, comfort and style are spot-on as well. The price was right as well. I have about 300 miles on them at this point, 10k+ feet of climb... so far, so good.

Long-winded, additional details: As for fit, I generally wear a 43.5 in a regular width for most cycling applications. Upon occasion 43.5 can be ever-so-slightly too big, so I tend to tighten the buckles/straps/laces close to the maximum or simply size down to a 43. The Shimano XC502 shoes barely slipped on to my foot in a 43. Given the impossibly snug fit of the 43, I foolishly ordered the 44 high volume shoe. The HV space was way too loose. Ultimately, sizing-up to the 44 worked. The best aspect of this purchase/return/purchase/return/purchase saga was working with Competitive Cyclist and their "gearheads." They made the entire process as easy as possible and I appreciate it.
review.name: Great shoe (after I found my fit)

name: XC502 Limited Edition Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I can wear this with only a long sleeve wool lightweight baselayer unerneath when doing high output mountaineering in 15-40 F weather, no wind.  I can also wear it comfortably around the house as long as it's not over 78F.  It packs down well, weighs very little.  I bought mine size M at 5' 9" and 185 lbs and it's form fitting but not tight.Just an amazing piece of gear.
review.name: Amazing warmth to weight ratio

review.reviewBody: The Nexus is incredibly comfortable and well fitting.  I have several fleeces like this. Patagonia R1 is the most similar, and this really takes the cake.  It breathes exceptionally well and retains heat when used as a mid layer.  The fit is fairly slim and form fitting, which is what I was looking for.
review.name: Amazing layer

name: Nexus Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Body Geometry Sport Gel Long Finger Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Color fabric and feel just right for my part of the world, low dessert, Southern NV region , keep my hands just warm enough and love the sensitivity when shifting, adjusting garmin, or accessing screens on devices. 

Gloves run small so I would size up.
 Great value for money, I only wear long finger gloves to protect digits.
review.name: Great glove

review.itemreviewed: Body Geometry Sport Gel Long Finger Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody:
A good option for days when fingerless gloves aren't warm enough, for short workouts.

Looking to extend road riding into fall/spring season, I've been searching for inexpensive and comfortable long-fingered gloves.  These fit my hands very well and are generally better than fingerless gloves in cooler temperatures (50-65F; 10-18C).  

I've worn them multiple times and find the padding is a bit thin relative to my fingerless gloves but hasn't caused me discomfort.  A typical ride for me is 75 min, 20miles, mix of flat and cat5 climbs/downhills.  When the temperature drops below 50F/10C, the fabric on the backs of hands is definitely too thin by nature of it's breathability.
review.name: Comfortable for cool days, thin padding

review.itemreviewed: Body Geometry Sport Gel Long Finger Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: They look great but the gloves folds in between the thumb and pointer finger.  They?re were very uncomfortable after one ride.
review.name: Look great, feel terrible when riding

review.itemreviewed: Body Geometry Sport Gel Long Finger Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: They?re really uncomfortable between the thumb and pointing finger
review.name: Not so good

name: Body Geometry Sport Gel Long Finger Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Waste of money the auto ignite doesn’t work……………..
review.name: Auto ignite doesn’t work, tried to get a refund
comment:
Hi Nic,
We understand your disappointment for this product. We apologize for any inconvenience that this may have caused you. We would like to learn more about your experience, please contact us at 1-800-835-3278. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9am -5pm Eastern Time. You can also fill out our contact form: https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us or place a formal claim here: https://www.coleman.com/warranty-information.html
Stay safe!
Coleman Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: It all looks good. I have not had time to try it out. I got it for emergency preparedness.
review.name: Looks great!

review.reviewBody: when I got the stove delivered from Coleman, both burners were bent at a 25 degree angle. Apparently no quality control at the factory.
review.name: cascade stove
comment:
Hello! We’re also disappointed that your stove is defective. This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. The business values and appreciates your opinion, and we will make sure that your ideas are shared.

If you have any additional queries or concerns about your product, you can also visit the Coleman website. Choose "contact us" from the question mark logo in the upper right corner of the page to access our online contact form.

review.reviewBody: In my opinion this is the best Coleman Stove. The clicking igniter is more durable than the push button type and it doesn't move the whole stove when trying to lite-up. The wind deflectors are simple and perform as advertised, the grate is durable and provides adequate support. I expect to have 50 year life with this stove in which it will outlast me. I have been using Coleman camping products since 1963 and this retro stove is the one to buy.
review.name: A classic retro stove you'll love.

review.reviewBody: We only rely on Coleman stoves while camping and I love this vintage green color! It works great and we bought it bc it’s big enough for 2 pots to cook at the same time.
review.name: Great stove!

review.reviewBody: I use my Coleman stove primarily for canning meat. The canner gets very heavy after it’s loaded with jars and my glass-top stove can not support the weight. But the Coleman stove can easily take the weight, it’s built well and has a very strong rack to set the canner on. I purchased this model due to the electronic ignition and regulated  flame control, both of which are very convenient for the canning process.
review.name: Sturdy Stove

review.reviewBody: I did not buy this stove. I was gifted this stove from my parents. I have a feeling I will be passing it on to my own children one day. This stove is indestructible and as efficient as when it was purchased in the 1990's. Easy to use. Easy to transport. It will outlive us all. Buy this stove.
review.name: This Stove Will Outlive Us All

review.reviewBody: The stove  itself works great.  The wire grate above the burners needs to be improved though.  The front-to-back bars in the grate are spaced too widely, and I tipped my frying pan several times and spilled some of the contents into the interior of the stove.  A couple more bars for each burner would be a big help.
review.name: Great stove - with a so-so grate over it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Our stove is over twenty years old and still works perfectly.
review.name: Affordable, easy to use, and extremely durable.

name: Cascade Classic Stove

review.reviewBody: The overall fit of the shorts is true to size, and the waistband is comfortable. However, the actual chamois is too dense and painful to sit on. Very disappointing.

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Dragonfly OSMO Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dragonfly OSMO Tent: 3-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Dragonfly OSMO Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great tent. 3 man fits 2 kids, wife, big dog, and me. Great pockets inside the tent walls. Have not had issues with getting wet. Have stayed dry in Olympic Peninsula rains.
review.name: Light and comfy

review.reviewBody: Very nice light weight and compact tent, the 2 person is great for 2 and it’s pretty simple to set up. It definitely needs to be secured well when it’s crazy windy or it will blow away! A person or pack inside does this well.
review.name: 6 1 fit no problem!

review.reviewBody: I was excited to finally replace my older model Dragonfly with the newer Osmo version. But, my excitement waned when I started putting up the fly. 4 stakes on the fly to keep it taught - uugh. I bought a freestanding tent so I didn't have to spend extra time at camp finding a soft spot for stakes. Or finding rocks for securing guys... If you don't get the 4 stakes in good places, you just can't get the fly taught and it flaps loudly in the wind. Also having uneven ground seemed to really tweak the fly layout. I don't even use vestibules for anything, so it's particularly maddening. Oh well, the Osmo fabric will be worth it - right. Well, sort of. Because it's hard to get the fly taught, it was really easy to get water splashing or rain driven under the cut out. So yup, rain in the tent. Osmo didn't help due to fly staking requirements. I wish I would have skipped this model and just done a trekking pole tent that uses fewer stakes than the dragonfly. Sorry Nemo, this needs to go back to engineering.
review.name: Takes too many stakes for fly

review.reviewBody: I paddled the Bowron Lakes Canoe circuit in northern British Columbia Canada this summer. Throughout the week, it rained quite heavily, but I found this tent to be exceptionally dry. Not one drop of water made itself onto me or my gear.
review.name: Dry tent

review.reviewBody:
We recently did a 7 night canoe expedition and was incredibly impressed with the Dragonfly OSMO waterproofing. We had a few nights where it rained almost all night, and we were completely dry in the morning. The fly is the best I've seen on a tent from NEMO.. some clever little touches that allow it to stay further away from the primary tent structure. It's also very easy and quick to set-up - intuitive and simple.
 
A few other things... We especially liked the reflective string of the fly tie downs that you see with your headlamp. We noticed a lot of other tents and tarps on the trip lacked this feature, but when you're walking around at night you really notice the difference and feel safer with the NEMO tents.
 
Materials all feel very high end. I really felt like this is one of the nicest tents I've used from NEMO - even better than the Kunai which I also own.
review.name: Amazing! Stayed bone dry on a 7 night expedition

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with weight, stuff sacks, features. I’ve had a few lightweight tents but this one is loaded with features and functionality
review.name: Doors!

review.reviewBody: Incredibly lightweight gear! Very happy with how this tent worked out for us. We thru-hiked the Trans Catalina Trail in March- the Dragonfly Osmo was easy/quick to put up and take down each day, fast drying, and truly the lightest tent we've ever carried. Hiking with it was an absolute breeze.
review.name: Dragonfly Osmo- InTENTS, in all the right ways!

review.reviewBody: Upon the first use of my tent, I had my initial concerns about the rain fly being too short on the "tall" end of the tent.  I had my tent set up on high ground and we had moderate rain for entire 1st day and had significant puddling of water on top of the tent foot print.  I didn't notice the puddling water unitl we packed up on the 3rd day.  The rain fly on the "tall" end of the tent needs to extend all the way to the ground like the other 3 sides.  Water ran off the fly, onto the tent wall and down and under the tent and puddled on top of the nemo footprint.  Perhaps using the guy line loop fly on the "tall" end would have helped this issue but a full length fly would most certainly help.  Also nemo needs to add a loop on the "short" end of the tent fly to pull the fly away with another guy line.  Fly was in contact with the tent wall and our sleeping bags were damp at the toe end.  I will say I was very grateful the fabric on the bottom of the tent was very water proof as i only had one small spot where there was a very small amount of seepage in the standing water.  I do like the ease of setup, the compact packed size, the light weight and the roominess of the 3P tent for 2 people.
review.name: Rain Fly Too Short!!

review.reviewBody: This tent is light and packs down very small. Purchased for backpacking and whitewater trips in Idaho, Oregon,California and Utah. This tent works great for 3 seasons and hiking with grandchildren and our dog. 3 average adults fit snugly in it, for 2 adults it is roomy and well vented. Free standing, and easy to put up.
review.name: Our go to tent.

review.reviewBody: This is a spectacular tent. I love that it's freestanding but still very lightweight compared to other freestanding tents. I purchased the 3P and there is endless room inside. This tent does great in all types of weather and will always keep you dry. My favorite tent ever
review.name: Perfect Tent!

name: Dragonfly OSMO Tent: 3-Person 3-Season
